title: Origins of San Juan Tahitic
description: The first documented records mark the settlement of founding families, establishing the foundations of a community rooted in agriculture and respect for the land.

title: Construction of the Main Church
description: The spiritual heart of the community was erected. The church was not only a center of faith but also the social meeting point that would unite generations.

modalContent.text: The construction of the church, dedicated to Saint John the Baptist, was a monumental effort that lasted more than a decade. Using limestone from local quarries and noble woods, the town's artisans built a building that would become the symbol of San Juan Tahitic's identity and faith. Its tower, visible from the entire valley, not only calls to mass but has also served as a beacon for travelers for centuries.

title: Do√±a Eladia, Master Weaver
description: Eladia Mendoza revolutionized local textile art by introducing new natural dyeing techniques. Her legacy endures in the vibrant colors of our crafts.

title: The First Great Tlayoyo Fair
description: What began as a harvest celebration became the most important gastronomic fair in the region, consolidating our culinary identity and attracting visitors.

title: Restoration of the Historic Center
description: A community and government initiative allowed the renovation of key facades and public spaces, revitalizing the heart of the town.

title: San Juan Tahitic, Magic Town
description: National recognition that boosts cultural tourism and the appreciation of our heritage, opening new opportunities for the community.
